website_summaries.verdict: A good, lightweight first bow for kids, but not for the serious/experienced archer.
pros: Provides good velocity and accurate shooting
cons: Bow doesn’t have the same power as pricier kids’ bows
String is too wide for proper arrow nock, and difficult to secure

customer_reviews.title: *Non paid*  Honest review
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a fun, dependable, well built now for your child, this is it. My 9 year old son LOVES his new Crosman. Any questions let me know ( again I paid for this myself and would buy again )
customer_reviews.author: Dexter Washington

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PRODUCT! WE ARE HIGHLY SATISFIED WITH IT!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's 10th bday and it's everything the description said it would be and the best price anywhere! It was half the price as everywhere else! It's made very well and is very sturdy and not made cheaply at all. We are very happy with this product and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: LetaDOLL

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set.
customer_reviews.text: We're getting into archery and it was difficult to decide on a recurve or compound. We chose this and were not disappointed. Attached is a picture to show you the size compared to an 11 year old child who LOVES his bow. The draw was a great tension for him and the set is a delightful starter bow. I recommend this for people starting out with their children and archery.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Arrows aren’t good-break easily
customer_reviews.text: This was for my son for Christmas. The bow fit him but the arrows broke within a dozen shots. So that was disappointing to have a gift and now he doesn’t have arrows to use. **we have a bow target so he didn’t shoot it at a wall or something that would naturally break the arrows
customer_reviews.author: candi buzzard

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for over a year now and it still works very well. We bought it for our 8 year old son as a starter bow and he loves it. (He was a big strong 8 year old though.) It is well made and shoots well, across our back yard to the target we bought. People buying this expecting a professional bow for an adult will be disappointed, but if we wanted a good quality STARTER bow for a youth at a great price and this was it. Only con is we keep losing arrows :)
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Quality bow at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed! My son has been wanting a bow for a long time. Finally selected this one and was very happy. We have no experience with bows so there was a learning curve and the instructions were not that helpful but this is a quality item! I was surprised that it came assembled, especially because the directions say you have to attach a few things. But he loves it and the adults had fun with it too. It really is sturdy and quality. I was worried at this price it would be more like a toy but it was great! My son is 9 years old, slim build at about 55 lbs but can pull it perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Smith

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it (I do too)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old who had never shot a bow before. He was shooting like a pro within a day. It’s so easy to use. My 12 year old (who is a lefty) also likes it. Surprisingly he managed to shoot left handed without having to change anything. I also enjoy shooting it. I think I may need to adjust the site, so I can’t attest to its accuracy, but it’s pretty close.
customer_reviews.author: Vekki

customer_reviews.title: Junk...stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously amazon why are you selling this ? It’s garbage. Didn’t even get to use it once. The sight didn’t install properly because the threaded nut was too large. Both arrows broken just trying to clip them onto the string! That’s crazy...I have used junk bows before and haven’t had this problem. Very disappointed. I know this is a budget set but come on it should at least work.
customer_reviews.author: RLS

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wanted to rate it 3.5, but cant so whatever. The arrows are really disappointing 2 out of 5. The feathers ( not really obviously, don't know the name ). The bottom of one ( the one that connects to the string ) broke in 20 minutes of shooting. The bow itself is REALLY high quality, especially for 40$. I didn't know to put 3 or 4 stars, so I did rock paper scissors with a friend and I lost so I put 3.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 1st bow for a youth
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 10 yo son and could not be happier with the purchase. The bow itself is sturdy and well made and the accessories (arm guard and finger tab) are basic but sufficient. The draw weight is perfect for a child, and the cams make it really easy to hold the draw and focus on aim. Would still be worth it at twice the price! Only recommendation would be to order extra arrows with the bow so you're not collecting them every 3 shots. Absolutely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: HikingMom

customer_reviews.title: ... daughter after she went to camp and fell in love with archery
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 11 year old daughter after she went to camp and fell in love with archery. Didn't want to spend to much on a first time bow and this fit the bill wit everything it came with it was a no brainer. She loves to shoot it and can manage it well. I even have fun shooting it with her. Great bow for middle school age and great little ad ons to make the whole experience better.
customer_reviews.author: Tseef87

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bad accuracy and the arrow tails on BOTH arrows were coming off only after 3-4 use ! Arrows are very bad quality and they are not even going through a target for it to damage the arrows. And the accuracy is horrible ...probably due to the bad arrows
customer_reviews.author: Alextuikx

customer_reviews.title: Give 'em something better.
customer_reviews.text: I know this is supposed to be for pre-teens. But they deserve better. The arrows break in a matter of a few uses. And the bow itself is so weak, it has no use. I can see this thing being used a few times, then getting either thrown out or put in storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: 26yrs old beginner
customer_reviews.text: Arrows suck 1 arrow broke before i could even use. Second on broke the next day had yo order more Ordered cheapest arrows on amazon orange ones 6 total they were 3 to 4 inches shorter but worked just fine and way more sturdy They need to provide more arrows at least 4 good ones
customer_reviews.author: fred barrientos

customer_reviews.title: Best of the bunch!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 3 different bows ( the Barnett Lil' Banshee, Bear Archer Scout, and the Crosman Elkhorn Jr.) as we have various ages of children that would be using them. This Crosman Elkhorn Jr. is a Great Bow, It has all the same extras as full size bow but at a great price!!! This one is hands down much better. It allows you to get familiar with the all the modern advances of today's compound bows without paying an arm and a leg. If you need a bow for a small child I would recommend the Bear Archer Scout over the Barnett Lil' Banshee since it's draw weight is much lower and very easy for little ones.
customer_reviews.author: The Vega Family

customer_reviews.title: Aim attachment is useless. Arrows weak. 5’4 adult
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 5’4 adult 130 lbs, and the bow works nicely work my arm length. The fins at the ends of the arrow come off pretty easily. After 2 hours of use, one of the 2 arrows had this problem. The attachment piece that is used to hold the arrow head for you is rubber, bendy, and flimsy. So it will be hard to use it to hold the arrow in place for you to aim properly. Otherwise, it looks cool, and shoots arrows
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a kid or beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great bow set for a kid. Shoots about 30 ft, with very little hit. It will punch paper, but that's it.. so it's very safe for kids. Pretty solid quality too.
customer_reviews.author: famdamily

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME😆
customer_reviews.text: awesome bow😆 definitely not for hunting though..unless you use a really sharp arrow head i suppose.. could probably kill a rabbit or bird.. the only downside is that the arrows don't last to long. the tip gets flattens easily and the nock breaks way too easy. i was just shooting at a box and the nock easily broke. considering the nock is made of plastic though, im not surprised. for $30 i'd say this is a good buy, depending on what you want to do with it.. obviousy if you have super high hopes for this, you wont be too happy.
customer_reviews.author: Loth

customer_reviews.title: Works for a 12 yr old who is just begining.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses this bow for archery class. She was 12 when I bought it for her and has used it for a year. It is a good beginner bow however it will not carry a pre-teen through teenage years. It will eventually need to be upgraded to a better quality bow. I'm currently researching bows to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Lady

customer_reviews.title: Nice kid's bow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for his 10th birthday. He is 5'02 and skinny but athletic. This bow fits him perfectly and the pull weight is just right for him to start out. He shot it three days in a row and had sore muscles. The bow was easy to assemble and it has plenty of power for a ten year old. It only includes two arrows but we found perfectly sized arrows (in blaze orange so they are easy to find) at Dick's Sporting Goods for $3.69 each. He loves the bow and it works well. I couldn't ask for more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sum Ole Gui

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for something that would be good for a young beginner
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 13 year old daughter on her birthday. I was looking for something that would be good for a young beginner, but not a small child. I also did not want to break the bank. This fit the bill perfectly. She takes it out every weekend for target practice. It's not too hard for her or her younger sister, but still give plenty of challenge and fun. If any other child should want a bow, I would choose this one again, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Has plenty of power for fishing
customer_reviews.text: This bow does not lend it's self to adding a reel but I was able to fabricate a bracket that works great. The bow is ideal for kids, but is compact enough and low powered enough to be ideal for fishing from a boat. I added a trigger release aid.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Clinkscales

customer_reviews.title: Great product, my 11 year old loved getting this ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my 11 year old loved getting this for his b day. My only complaint was the arrows breaking. The 2nd time he used them. I'm not sure if they were the right ones for the force of the bow or not. We had to order a different set separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... daughter who is a novice and she seems to enjoy it. It is seemingly well made and quite ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is a novice and she seems to enjoy it. It is seemingly well made and quite durable. I've played around with it, and it certainly packs a hefty bunch. It was simple enough to put together, I watched a youtube video because the instructions confused me. I'd buy it again and recommend it to a child getting into archery.
customer_reviews.author: Lana KayTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first bow just to see if I would enjoy archery. I thought it would be small and very low quality but I didn't care. It's has far exceeded my expectations! For only $40 it's fantastic! The draw weight and draw length are both perfect. My draw length is 26 and I am not as strong as I thought I was and the draw weight is 15. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Annie King

customer_reviews.title: Great little bow
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my 11 year old daughter. She had no trouble pulling it back and it fit her very well. This bow performed better than I expected. It's not deadly accurate, by any means, but she had no trouble hitting my bow target. She has fun with it and enjoys playing with it. It won't shoot much more than 15 yards without a signifiant arc, but it's been kinda fun for her trying to hit stuff further off. She just has to aim really high. This isn't really a negative for this product as I didn't expect it to be something that would stack arrows at 30 yards. Quality is decent and the minor assembly is easy.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 9 y/o nephew. As I watched him draw back 2ND TIME on the line, the bottom end of the bow snapped off, nearly hitting his face. This might have been a one time defect, but it could have had devastating effects, blinding him or injuring him severely. I've never seen a more dangerous defect in anything I have bought or ordered on amazon. I expect a refund and an explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Blue

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: very happy with this. Bought it for my teenage kids to have some fun with when we rented a cabin and it worked great. nothing to do but point and shoot. out of the box ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: bossman

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners of all ages
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, very easy to use. My 12 year old, who bought it for himself can easily use it, my husband and I can also use it, and even my 9 year old daughter was able to use it after a little extra effort.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy4My4

customer_reviews.title: Our son's Christmas wish
customer_reviews.text: This was a HUGE successfuly purchase for our son. His one Christmas wish was for a compound bow. My husband ordered another from Amazon that was WAY TOO advanced for him (he couldn't lift it up) and bought another at a sporting goods store. Third times the charm... Our son loves this bow. He shoots accurately and loves it. We did replace the arrows with more accurate arrows because the ones that come with it are not great. He is so into archery and loves to go out with Dad and shoot. He is a strong 6 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 10 - 12 Novice
customer_reviews.text: The draw weight is a little too heavy for my ten year-old daughter, but she will grow into it. Fun to use, easy to aim and has a surprisingly fast arrow flight for what it is. This bow can indeed inflict damage to people and to animals. Be forewarned that this bow is dangerous and should not be thought of as merely a toy. Keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: SPDKLD

customer_reviews.title: works for a cheap bow.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, but as a beginner it worked, my son quickly advanced but that meant a $500 bow. I would suggest spending more from a professional archery shop with support if you think it will become more than a toy.
customer_reviews.author: timl

customer_reviews.title: Decent bow but arrows break so easily. I mean the end of arrows
customer_reviews.text: Decent bow but arrows break so easily. I mean the end of arrows. I have to get other arrows from Walmart. Their ending part are make from soft plastic so when it hit the ground the arrow didn't break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: may be good for a 8 year old boy
customer_reviews.text: this bow is very weak, may be good for a 8 year old boy, we were so disappointed when we used it. then, the return window is only 1 month. this was a really bad investment.
customer_reviews.author: miguel

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for money.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. My 10 year old thinks he's Hawkeye now. So I got that going for me. Good way to get your kid in the sport.
customer_reviews.author: Cale

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner bow.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her new bow and it came with a lot of accessories. I just need to get more arrows as she has lost some over the target into the woods on our property.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great little bow
customer_reviews.text: Great little bow, its almost too small for me and is definitely lower power than I would like, that being said it is a 25lbs bow and it shoots well. I wouldn't use it for hunting but for a smaller target practice its a fun bow.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Tough little bow for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bow for my wife so that I could help her enter into the world of archery. Upon receiving the bow, it was fairly easy to assemble and compile. The bow itself is actually very nice and sturdy, with some arrows accompanying for starting. She greatly enjoys shooting it, even though it is limited in draw strength and power. The only downfall of this item is after shooting for a while the internal bolts become loose, causing the attachments to shake and rattle a bit. I actually considered getting some different bolts for it, but for now they will do.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kragel

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner bow
customer_reviews.text: Great little beginner bow. Got this for my kids to learn on. A little too hard for my 7 year old to draw back, but shouldn’t be long before he could. The two arrows it came with broke already from the plastic piece that goes onto the string.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: A good bow for the price
customer_reviews.text: A good bow for the price. The only negative is our teenage son has easily broke the holder on side for arrows... Seemed a bit cheap design for a overall well made bow. Don't let that stop you from buying because it works well and helps teach the young kids how to use, aim, and hit his/her targets. GOOD beginner bow for practice shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Fun bow
customer_reviews.text: My son is 9. This is a great starter bow for learning. Make sure you shoot in a non grass area or put something down on the ground. This bow has some power. In missing the target, the arrows have shot into the grass/ground and we can not find them!!!!
customer_reviews.author: star1711

customer_reviews.title: They love it! The green part of the arrows had ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 if there for my sons. They love it! The green part of the arrows had broke after a couple uses so I need to search for better quality arrows. Other then that great product.
customer_reviews.author: Roxxi

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice to get useful assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: The bow came with some misc parts, but the instructions are so bad that I'm not sure what to do with them. They could not be bothered to include a detailed diagram of the bow. Instead, you get some fragmentary diagrams that don't show how it is oriented or how the parts attach. The sight seems pretty useless and I'm not sure what the hand-shaped piece of foam is for. Hopefully, it works, but considering the poor attention to detail on the instructions and accessories, I'm not expecting much.
customer_reviews.author: DThal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect First Bow
customer_reviews.text: This is a well constructed bow that’s a perfect size for an eleven year old. My grandson has figured out how to use it and it appears to be the appropriate size.
customer_reviews.author: Debra A.. Shipley

customer_reviews.title: The perfect & affordable beginner bow!
customer_reviews.text: This bow is my first and it was a perfect choice for the price. Best beginner archery set I could imagine. The only issue I had was the arrows, but it's not a big deal since arrows are inexpensive. I have recommended this bow to friends.
customer_reviews.author: ZMan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Excellent size/pull for an 80 pound girl
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Excellent size/pull for an 80 pound girl. As others stated, the included accessories are really cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Magellan

customer_reviews.title: Quality is better than expected
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this is much better than I expected, especially for the price and with the little added extras. My grandson was very happy to receive this. Since he is just getting started in using a bow I didn't want to spend a lot of money on one but this is a very nice bow. I bought him the compound and also the recurve
customer_reviews.author: tenminus9

customer_reviews.title: Bow it self is great, but a arrows it come with not good
customer_reviews.text: Bow it a starter for right handed youth. Bow it self is great,but a arrows it come with not good,we went and bought youth arrows at bass pro. Other then that it seems durable and easy to use for 8years old kid.my son love it!
customer_reviews.author: m j

customer_reviews.title: Good honest fun
customer_reviews.text: I love the bow, I just wish it had just a little more power, I mean I shot it through 2 inches of wood, but I feel like it could have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Lucien Arruela

customer_reviews.title: My son was super excited to get this for his 10th birthday
customer_reviews.text: My son was super excited to get this for his 10th birthday. I'm not one to judge on quality, but it seems sturdy and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle A Yates

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: Draw weight is fine but the length is too long. Im 5’4 and its my draw length. Def too long for my 9 yr old son. He can draw it fine but breaks with his hand behind his head. If its truelly a Jr bow, it needs to be adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin mceachern

customer_reviews.title: Everything it claims to be...good bow for good price
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old can draw it back but it is still fun for me to fire. (And I am an Army vet who has used all sorts of crazy weapons...:-) Solid construction and just enough draw to be able to hit from a reasonable distance. I am sure with the right arrows I could hunt small game with this. Certainly great for target practice. Arrows stink but the bow is great.
customer_reviews.author: Pantero

customer_reviews.title: ... for our 9 year old and it has been wonderful! It has been easy for him to use ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this last winter as a birthday gift for our 9 year old and it has been wonderful! It has been easy for him to use and easy for hi to enjoy. It seems to be wonderful quality as several of our other boys borrow it often and it has yet to break,or appear worn. We did find it hard to get the specific arrows locally but they do come with some and you are also able to order them online. We would buy this over again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Momofboys

customer_reviews.title: Bow has worked out beautifully and my grandson absolutely loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son ordered this for his 8 year old son. Bow has worked out beautifully and my grandson absolutely loves it! Note: grandson was 49 inches tall when ordered and it was a perfect fit. Highly recommend this bow!
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: The bow was awesome and flawless when shooting
customer_reviews.text: The bow was awesome and flawless when shooting! Quality of the bow was great for the price! I experienced when i shot the bow the arrow wings started to tear but its easy to fix overall i recommend this bow to anyone who is a beginner in archery!
customer_reviews.author: T. Benavides

customer_reviews.title: Still like new after over a year of occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Still like new after over a year of occasional use...has been a great solutions for my daughter to shoot with us occasionally and not break the bank
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's light weight and perfect resistance for a youth beginner in archery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bow at full price for my 8 yr old son and he loves it. It's light weight and perfect resistance for a youth beginner in archery.
customer_reviews.author: James Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son loves it, perfect for a beginner
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bow Trash Arrows
customer_reviews.text: Great Bow, I cant figure out the sights but thats my problem. However the arrows are quite fragile. Its been one day and both arrows have lost a feather thingy. But other than that it is great and so much fun. Changed to a 3 star because the sight has broken.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Pinkerton

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for my kids to target shoot with but ...
customer_reviews.text: A little cheesier than I thought but I probably should have looked a little closer at the pics. Good enough for my kids to target shoot with but I really wanted to be able to put a good site and rest on the bow for them. It is still a great intro at a great price to see if they are even interested in archery.
customer_reviews.author: Climb & Dive

customer_reviews.title: Ok bow, terrible arrows.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good bow for the price, but the arrows are worthless. The ends broke after shooting them once. The green plastic is too inflexible.
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for a 10yr old!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10yr old, and its perfect for him! The draw weight is great for him, not too easy and not too hard. The bow itself isn't heavy, but it doesn't feel cheaply made. A great gift for someone interested in archery!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Just ok nothing special
customer_reviews.text: Should be advertised as young youth very low in power had to step up almost immediately
customer_reviews.author: Kaylaree13

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good target practice bow perfect for beginner archer or youth
customer_reviews.author: pete d

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money and get something better for older kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a bow for up to 12 year olds. Spend the money and get something better for older kids.
customer_reviews.author: SWHEATH

customer_reviews.title: A great buy.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. It takes some getting used too for younger boys but my 11 year old loves to shoot it now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good starter bow for a pre-teen
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his bow. He shoots regularly. He has had it over a month and it is holding up to his use of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The arrows broke right away but the bow is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Diana Gates

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: This bow is poorly made. Bought this for my 10 yr old. Hubby and son went to use it and the arrow broke on the first use and it the arrow falls off every time you try to use it. I would not recommend it. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Nice bow set
customer_reviews.text: Nice bow set. Missing one piece but does not impact the functionality overall. Made a workaround. Amazon refunded part of cost for the inconvenience. Easy to use for my 13 year old. Use for target shooting in back. Not at great distance.
customer_reviews.author: Capt

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my granddaughter and it worked perfectly for her. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for 9 year old boy
customer_reviews.text: My nine year old son can use this bow. This was the first bow we've bought him to see if he'd be interested in archery. With this, he goes to practice on his own and while his skill is very low, this is exactly what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: but bow is good for kids
customer_reviews.text: arrows are sub par , but bow is good for kids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Love it my kids haven't stop playing with it. One arrow broke as soon as it was opened. Will have to purchased arrows.
customer_reviews.author: Everil G.

customer_reviews.title: Good bow set for starters
customer_reviews.text: Good compound-bow for starting kids with archery; my 10 year old is comfortable with it and has enough strength to pull back the string and delighted to be using a "real bow & arrow" set. Some minor assembly required to attach quiver & sighting to bow frame, but the instructions did not quite correspond to parts in the package, so I had to search the company website, which does have a helpful video on how to attach the various components to the frame.
customer_reviews.author: WADilger

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for 12 and under
customer_reviews.text: Great for a beginner, if your kid is about 12 or younger. Light weight and for the price it's a great starter For teaching
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this bow...I just wish there was a knock.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: will look to upgrade from this one soon
customer_reviews.text: missing a screw that holds the sites in place, there was not sticky pad to install the arrow rest either. The forearm pad is just a piece of plastic and will not last
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this bow, and I've tried a few
customer_reviews.text: Have used Bear and Genesis compound and recurve bows with kids over the years. This Crosman is a very good bow for a beginner youth, or experienced one at that. For an adult/older teen though, the girth of the grip and the draw length are a bit small.
customer_reviews.author: B. Healy

customer_reviews.title: perfect begginer bow
customer_reviews.text: this was a purchase for Christmas for my son. As with most kids not sure if this will be hit much after 1/15, so did not want to break the bank on the purchase. months later he still loves to go and target practice. at his size this is the perfect bow. perhaps at an older age it may be to small, so I would say for 9-13 years old could not go wrong with this
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew. The arrows broke with in a couple times of using them. A bit disappointed with the quality .
customer_reviews.author: Katrina DeSimone

customer_reviews.title: Beginners can use with confidence
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Great starter for teens-adults. I'm in my 50s and enjoyed every minute of my lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Toya F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, arrows kinda cheap, arm guard as well. Bow itself is nice for the price
customer_reviews.author: JoeV

customer_reviews.title: We had to go buy some nice arrows elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10 year old son. It is about the right weight and the bow worked well. However both arrows it came with broke the first night we used it. We had to go buy some nice arrows elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a little smaller than I thought it wold be, ...
customer_reviews.text: a little smaller than I thought it wold be, but the price was right, and the product is working well for my grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Bow
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bow for the price it's at! It was slightly difficult in the beginning at first to try to figure out how to use it properly but it's easy to get a hang of. The accessories are a great addition as well :)
customer_reviews.author: Neelam

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner's Bow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bow for myself (I'm 13)and I am very impressed although I highly recommend buying new accessories. Some are better than others, but I suggest getting a new armguard and arrows (it comes with two). I found the sighting system hard to use, but I spent very little time toying around with it because I shoot instinctively. The bow itself is where your $50 shows. It is fairly easy to draw back and has suprising power. If you want a cheap, good quality bow, look no further than the Crossman Elkhorn Jr.
customer_reviews.author: DJS Boston

customer_reviews.title: bow is great, arrows suck
customer_reviews.text: bow is great, arrows suck. tips break easily, had to order more arrows. son loves it when he has good arrows.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Reinhold

customer_reviews.title: Good little bow
customer_reviews.text: Ok for taget shooting in the backyard, nice & neat OK power
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Arrows are not robust
customer_reviews.text: The bow is good but I am very disappointed with the arrows. They broke after only a couple trials and we cannot yse the biw anymore. Very bad quality.
customer_reviews.author: NICOLAS DEMURGE

customer_reviews.title: The bow itself is pretty decent. Its pretty easy to set up though ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got tow of these for my boys, age 11 and 14. The bow itself is pretty decent. Its pretty easy to set up though the instruction manual isn't the best. I ended up going by YouTube videos instead. The only reason for knocking a star off is that the arrows fell apart, the tip broke off after a few shots into a cardboard box and there are only two arrows included for a fuller quiver. All in all, I'd recommend this for juniors getting into archery.
customer_reviews.author: Charley Baker

customer_reviews.title: its more for teenagers but good to start them off with one that will last ...
customer_reviews.text: bought for my 7yr old brother and thought maybe he will grow into it. but he uses it all the time! its more for teenagers but good to start them off with one that will last a while and more of a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro Bow
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 1st bow for the young beginner archer. Lightweight and well made. well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: S Godbey

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, but chintzy accessories
customer_reviews.text: Cheap set. The accessories are chintzy. The bow and arrows are nice.
customer_reviews.author: amac

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this bow a two star rating because the label is a bit misleading. When I ordered this bow, I discovered that it did not have a 17-21 lb draw weight but instead, the package said the maximum draw weight is 15 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it. I got it for my seven year ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I got it for my seven year old son and he loves. He has a little trouble pulling it back at first but in a few weeks I don't see it being a problem for him.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Tannehill

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bow
customer_reviews.text: Great starter bow. Just enough power to be efective on target, and easy enough on the arms to learn the basics. Will need to upgrade when they get bigger, but thats the point. Learn the right way to do it then move up.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for a young beginner
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 year old son loves this set that he got for Christmas! Seems solid enough for a beginner like he is.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works good for the money invested. My son is 10 and it's a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: JustinCase

customer_reviews.title: Both were able to draw and release the bow and had great fun practicing
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my 10 and 12 year old boys. Both were able to draw and release the bow and had great fun practicing. Both got really proficient and are waiting for spring to have more fun.
customer_reviews.author: C0recollector

product_meta.title: CenterPoint Archery ABY1721 Elkhorn Youth Compound Bow
product_meta.description:
The CenterPoint Elkhorn is the perfect intermediate archer compound bow for building skills and proficiency, designed with the look and feel of Dad's bow. Featuring durable, heavy-weight composite limbs, an integrated composite center shot riser with large sight window and heavy-duty all-weather strings. The Elkhorn has a draw length of up to 26-inches, up to 15-pound draw weight and a brace height of 8-inches with 65% let off. The Elkhorn measures 33-inches from tip to tip and comes ready to shoot with two 26-inch composite arrows, two-piece quiver, finger tab, arm guard, arrow rest and adjustable pin sight. We’ve made it easy to match aspiring archers with a CenterPoint Archery youth bow.

AMAZON.COM


Designed with the look and feel of Dad's bow. The Elkhorn bow comes equipped with durable, heavyweight composite limbs and an integrated composite center shot riser with large sight window. The composite cam system is supported by heavy duty all-weather strings and cables complete with cable guard for superior shooting performance. The 33" axle is designed for the starting compound bow shooter. The 17-21 lb. draw weight is ideal for beginners ages 12 and up. The 26" max draw allows for years of use with the same bow set. The 8" brace height is an exceptional design providing ultimate forgiveness during the shot. The 1 lb. 12 oz. mass weight is very versatile for balance and feel. The right-hand grip integrated design allows for optimum hand placement. The 65% let off cam/wheel design provides outstanding shooting performance.

Adjustable Sight Cam Wheel System PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS
 * Model Number ABY1721
 * Weight 3.3 lbs
 * Axle-to-Axle Length 33"
 * Brace Height 8"
 * Draw Weight 17 to 21 lbs
 * Max draw 26"
 * Limbs 1 Piece Composite
 * Riser Composite
 * System Cam Wheel
 * Package Set 2 Composite Arrows, rest, sight, arm guard, 2 piece quiver, finger tab
feature_bullets: DURABLE, HEAVY-WEIGHT COMPOSITE LIMBS - With integrated composite center-shot riser
DRAW LENGTH UP TO 26-INCHES - 15-pound draw weight
33-INCHES TIP TO TIP - with 8-inch brace height
33 inch axel to axel length, adjustable 17 to 21 pounds draw, ideal for beginners
Integrated design to allow for optimum hand placement for right handed shooters
8 inches brace height exceptional design for ultimate forgiveness during the shot
26 inches max draw allows for years of use with the same bow set
Package includes two youth composite arrows, two piece quiver, arm guard, finger tab, sights and arrow rest
INCLUDES - Two 26-inche composite arrows, quiver, finger tab, arm guard, arrow rest and adjustable pin sight
